entry.string: If a user exists in SQL but does not have a login account to Xaraya, the user will not be able to login. By selecting the option below and entering the attribute values, a user that has account information in SQL will be automatically added to the Xaraya database and allowed to login. If this option is left unchecked, the Xaraya Anonymous role is used if authentication is successful (not sure how this is useful?).
entry.translation: Iff a user ixeests in SQL boot dues nut hefe-a a lugeen eccuoont tu Xereya, zee user veell nut be-a eble-a tu lugeen. Bork bork bork! By selecteeng zee oopshun beloo und intereeng zee ettreeboote-a felooes, a user thet hes eccuoont inffurmeshun in SQL veell be-a ootumeteecelly edded tu zee Xereya detebese-a und ellooed tu lugeen. Iff thees oopshun is lefft unchecked, zee Xereya Ununymuoos rule-a is used iff oozeenteeceshun is sooccessffool (nut soore-a hoo thees is useffool?).

entry.string: Add SQL User to Xaraya Database on Login
entry.translation: Edd SQL User tu Xereya Detebese-a oon Lugeen

entry.string: Store User's SQL Password in the Xaraya Database?
entry.translation: Sture-a User's SQL Pessvurd in zee Xereya Detebese-a?
